title: MELD Na (UNOS/OPTN)
description: Quantifies end-stage liver disease for transplant planning with sodium, used by UNOS for liver allocation since 2016

parameters.name: creatinine
parameters.description: Serum creatinine in mg/dL. If patient on dialysis ≥2 times in past week, use 4.0. If <1.0, use 1.0

parameters.name: bilirubin
parameters.description: Total bilirubin in mg/dL. If <1.0, use 1.0

parameters.name: sodium
parameters.description: Serum sodium in mEq/L. Values <125 are set to 125, values >137 are set to 137

parameters.name: dialysis_twice_past_week
parameters.description: Has the patient had dialysis (hemodialysis, peritoneal dialysis, CVVHD) at least twice in the past week?

result.name: meld_na_score
result.description: MELD Na score for liver disease severity

ranges.interpretation: 3-month mortality approximately 1.9%. Lower priority for liver transplant. Continue routine monitoring and management.
3-month mortality approximately 6.0%. Moderate priority for liver transplant. Consider hepatology referral if not already established. Monitor labs regularly.
3-month mortality approximately 19.6%. High priority for liver transplant. Requires close monitoring and aggressive management of complications.
3-month mortality approximately 52.6%. Very high priority for liver transplant. Consider ICU-level care for complications.
3-month mortality approximately 71.3%. Highest priority for liver transplant. Requires intensive care management.

references: Kim WR, Biggins SW, Kremers WK, Wiesner RH, Kamath PS, Benson JT, et al. Hyponatremia and mortality among patients on the liver-transplant waiting list. N Engl J Med. 2008 Sep 4;359(10):1018-26. doi: 10.1056/NEJMoa0801209.
Kamath PS, Kim WR; Advanced Liver Disease Study Group. The model for end-stage liver disease (MELD). Hepatology. 2007 Mar;45(3):797-805. doi: 10.1002/hep.21563.
OPTN Policy 9: Allocation of Livers and Liver-Intestines. Organ Procurement and Transplantation Network. Effective January 11, 2016.
formula: MELD(i) = 0.957 × ln(Cr) + 0.378 × ln(bilirubin) + 1.120 × ln(INR) + 0.643, then if MELD(i) > 11: MELD Na = MELD(i) + 1.32 × (137 - Na) - [0.033 × MELD(i) × (137 - Na)]
notes: Used by UNOS/OPTN for liver transplant allocation since January 2016
Sodium adjustment only applied if initial MELD > 11
For patients on dialysis ≥2 times in past week, creatinine value is set to 4.0
Laboratory values less than 1.0 are set to 1.0 for calculation
Sodium values are bounded between 125-137 mEq/L
Final score is rounded to nearest whole number and bounded between 6-40
